description: The ListReviewPolicyResultsForHIT operation retrieves the computed results and the actions taken in the course of executing your Review Policies for a given HIT. For information about how to specify Review Policies when you call CreateHIT, see Review Policies. The ListReviewPolicyResultsForHIT operation can return results for both Assignment-level and HIT-level review results.

parameters.name: HITId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the HIT to retrieve review results for.

parameters.name: PolicyLevels
parameters.description: The Policy Level(s) to retrieve review results for - HIT or Assignment. If omitted, the default behavior is to retrieve all data for both policy levels. For a list of all the described policies, see Review Policies. (string) ---

nested_items.name: HITId
nested_items.description: The HITId of the HIT for which results have been returned.

nested_items.name: AssignmentReviewPolicy
nested_items.description: The name of the Assignment-level Review Policy. This contains only the PolicyName element.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: Name of a Review Policy: SimplePlurality/2011-09-01 or ScoreMyKnownAnswers/2011-09-01

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: Name of the parameter from the Review policy.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Name of the parameter from the list of Review Polices.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The list of values of the Parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MapEntries
nested_items.description: List of ParameterMapEntry objects.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The QuestionID from the HIT that is used to identify which question requires Mechanical Turk to score as part of the ScoreMyKnownAnswers/2011-09-01 Review Policy.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The list of answers to the question specified in the MapEntry Key element. The Worker must match all values in order for the answer to be scored correctly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: HITReviewPolicy
nested_items.description: The name of the HIT-level Review Policy. This contains only the PolicyName element.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: Name of a Review Policy: SimplePlurality/2011-09-01 or ScoreMyKnownAnswers/2011-09-01

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: Name of the parameter from the Review policy.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Name of the parameter from the list of Review Polices.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The list of values of the Parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MapEntries
nested_items.description: List of ParameterMapEntry objects.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The QuestionID from the HIT that is used to identify which question requires Mechanical Turk to score as part of the ScoreMyKnownAnswers/2011-09-01 Review Policy.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The list of answers to the question specified in the MapEntry Key element. The Worker must match all values in order for the answer to be scored correctly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AssignmentReviewReport
nested_items.description: Contains both ReviewResult and ReviewAction elements for an Assignment.

nested_items.name: ReviewResults
nested_items.description: A list of ReviewResults objects for each action specified in the Review Policy.

nested_items.name: ActionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier of the Review action result.

nested_items.name: SubjectId
nested_items.description: The HITID or AssignmentId about which this result was taken. Note that HIT-level Review Policies will often emit results about both the HIT itself and its Assignments, while Assignment-level review policies generally only emit results about the Assignment itself.

nested_items.name: SubjectType
nested_items.description: The type of the object from the SubjectId field.

nested_items.name: QuestionId
nested_items.description: Specifies the QuestionId the result is describing. Depending on whether the TargetType is a HIT or Assignment this results could specify multiple values. If TargetType is HIT and QuestionId is absent, then the result describes results of the HIT, including the HIT agreement score. If ObjectType is Assignment and QuestionId is absent, then the result describes the Worker's performance on the HIT.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Key identifies the particular piece of reviewed information.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The values of Key provided by the review policies you have selected.

nested_items.name: ReviewActions
nested_items.description: A list of ReviewAction objects for each action specified in the Review Policy.

nested_items.name: ActionId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the action.

nested_items.name: ActionName
nested_items.description: The nature of the action itself. The Review Policy is responsible for examining the HIT and Assignments, emitting results, and deciding which other actions will be necessary.

nested_items.name: TargetId
nested_items.description: The specific HITId or AssignmentID targeted by the action.

nested_items.name: TargetType
nested_items.description: The type of object in TargetId.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current disposition of the action: INTENDED, SUCCEEDED, FAILED, or CANCELLED.

nested_items.name: CompleteTime
nested_items.description: The date when the action was completed.

nested_items.name: Result
nested_items.description: A description of the outcome of the review.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: Present only when the Results have a FAILED Status.

nested_items.name: HITReviewReport
nested_items.description: Contains both ReviewResult and ReviewAction elements for a particular HIT.

nested_items.name: ReviewResults
nested_items.description: A list of ReviewResults objects for each action specified in the Review Policy.

nested_items.name: ActionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier of the Review action result.

nested_items.name: SubjectId
nested_items.description: The HITID or AssignmentId about which this result was taken. Note that HIT-level Review Policies will often emit results about both the HIT itself and its Assignments, while Assignment-level review policies generally only emit results about the Assignment itself.

nested_items.name: SubjectType
nested_items.description: The type of the object from the SubjectId field.

nested_items.name: QuestionId
nested_items.description: Specifies the QuestionId the result is describing. Depending on whether the TargetType is a HIT or Assignment this results could specify multiple values. If TargetType is HIT and QuestionId is absent, then the result describes results of the HIT, including the HIT agreement score. If ObjectType is Assignment and QuestionId is absent, then the result describes the Worker's performance on the HIT.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The values of Key provided by the review policies you have selected.

nested_items.name: ReviewActions
nested_items.description: A list of ReviewAction objects for each action specified in the Review Policy.

nested_items.name: ActionId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the action.

nested_items.name: ActionName
nested_items.description: The nature of the action itself. The Review Policy is responsible for examining the HIT and Assignments, emitting results, and deciding which other actions will be necessary.

nested_items.name: TargetId
nested_items.description: The specific HITId or AssignmentID targeted by the action.

nested_items.name: TargetType
nested_items.description: The type of object in TargetId.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current disposition of the action: INTENDED, SUCCEEDED, FAILED, or CANCELLED.

nested_items.name: CompleteTime

nested_items.name: Result
nested_items.description: A description of the outcome of the review.

nested_items.description: Present only when the Results have a FAILED Status.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If the previous response was incomplete (because there is more data to retrieve), Amazon Mechanical Turk returns a pagination token in the response. You can use this pagination token to retrieve the next set of results.
